cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north over the west-central Gulf, then expected to turn northeast and cross the southeast Louisiana coast before tracking inland across MS/AL and the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near or just west of Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – warning has replaced watches
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southwest Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) are likely to arrive late Friday into Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–3 ft of surge possible along coastal Plaquemines Parish and adjacent lakes/bays, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inches with isolated pockets up to 12 inches, producing flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Friday afternoon; brief river rises and strong currents on the lower Mississippi River channel.
